algorithm_technique: Run-length encoding (RLE) to group consecutive characters and their counts.
problem_summary_simple: Count words that can be stretched to match a target string by extending character groups.
problem_summary_technical: RLE compresses strings into character-count pairs; words are stretchy if RLE matches and counts satisfy extension rules.
time_complexity: O(N + S), where N is total length of words, S is length of S
space_complexity: O(L + S), where L is max word length
key_insights: Run-length encoding is crucial for efficiently comparing character groups.
The condition for stretchy words involves matching character sequences and count constraints (>=3 for extension).
Itertools.groupby is a Pythonic way to implement RLE.
